sentence.text: She would have been appalled to think she 'd added to her sister 's problems .
Tinnion is appalled to discover that his old friend proposes to throw in his lot with the Nazis .
I was appalled to find him investing a portion of our diminutive budget in some sixty bowls .
She was appalled to feel her eyes fill with tears , blinking them away furiously .
Lindsey shunted the thought quickly aside , appalled to feel the faint colour rising in her cheeks as she forced herself to meet Niall 's questioning gaze .
The MP demanding an inquiry said : ` I am appalled that this man was given parole .
I am appalled that so much obvious commercial mileage goes to waste .
I am appalled that the Government have not learnt the lesson from Scotland .
` I 'm appalled that a blind person can be treated in this way and want to raise money to buy a guide dog .
She was appalled that women should be attended by male doctors , and of male attendance in childbirth she wrote :
I write to say how appalled I was at the bad manners of BAIE members at the Editing for Industry awards dinner in Torquay .
He was appalled when he realized his omission .
South African rugby folk were appalled when Canadian sprinter Ben Johnson was caught and banned for using steroids .
Her mother had been appalled when Robbie unwrapped the nightshirt and displayed it .
Pauline Humphries at the nursery said : “ We were appalled when we heard what had happened .
Mrs Leigh was appalled at what she had asked your mother .
` We have waited 22 months for justice to be done and are appalled at the verdict , " it read .
` I 'm sorry , " she said , appalled at what she 'd done .
He stopped , appalled at himself .
Huyton councillor Fred Curran said he was appalled at the cuts in the library book fund .

Happily , the Department of the Environment was so appalled at being cast as the number one villain that the certificates came almost by return of post and the Coal Board now felt isolated and exposed .
She was appalled at being forced to accept this .
Three days later , in the Sunday Telegraph , he will admit to being ` appalled at how un-Thatcherite the Tory leaders have sounded " throughout the campaign .
She felt chastised , like a child , confused and foolish -- and appalled at how deeply his displeasure had affected her .
Chairman of the Northamptonshire Police Federation says he 's appalled at how lenient the sentence is .
` Oh , gosh , " said Daisy appalled .
Miss Hatherby was appalled .
